summary: This is an email chain from August 13, 2019, discussing the coordination of victim and witness interviews for the active grand jury investigation into Jeffrey Epstein (case 19 Cr. 490 (RMB)). The correspondence involves prosecutors and a victim's attorney arranging logistics and confirming the ongoing nature of the investigation.

persons.name: Colleen Mullen
persons.context: She is the sender of the initial email, coordinating meetings for her clients with prosecutors in New York and requesting travel arrangements and counseling resources.

persons.name: Teri Gibbs
persons.role: Email recipient/possibly legal or support staff
persons.context: Listed as a recipient (Cc) on Colleen Mullen's email regarding victim interview coordination.

persons.name: Arick Fudali
persons.role: Email recipient/possibly legal or support staff
persons.context: Listed as a recipient (Cc) on Colleen Mullen's email regarding victim interview coordination.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the criminal investigation (case 19 Cr. 490 (RMB)) for which victim interviews are being coordinated.

connections.description: Mullen is an attorney representing victims in the criminal case against Jeffrey Epstein, coordinating their interviews with prosecutors.

events.title: Scheduled Victim Interview with Prosecutors
events.description: A meeting scheduled for a victim (client of Colleen Mullen) with prosecutors in New York at 12:00 p.m.

events.title: Email Coordination for Grand Jury Investigation
events.description: Email correspondence confirms an active grand jury investigation is ongoing, with discussions about bringing in victims and witnesses, some via subpoena.

keyFacts: As of August 13, 2019, there was an active grand jury investigation into Jeffrey Epstein under case number 19 Cr. 490 (RMB).
Prosecutors were actively coordinating to interview victims and witnesses, with some interviews scheduled (e.g., August 26, 2019) and discussions about using grand jury subpoenas.
Attorney Colleen Mullen was arranging travel and lodging for her clients (victims) to meet with prosecutors in New York and inquired about counseling resources for them.
Internal procedural questions were raised about the proper legal basis (grand jury, pre-trial, etc.) for bringing witnesses into the SDNY for interviews following Epstein's indictment.
